member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus
member.summary: ONVIF Status received from the ONVIF native code.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.INVALID_VALUE
member.summary: Invalid

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_OK
member.summary: Success

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_FAIL
member.summary: Failed

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_BADPARAMETER
member.summary: We passed the native code a bad parameter

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_MEMORYERROR
member.summary: Native code memory error

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_MUTEXERROR
member.summary: Native code mutex error

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_EMPTYBUFFER
member.summary: ERR_EMPTYBUFFER means that everything went "good" just that there was nothing to pass back (ie. Discovery did not find a match.)

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_OUTOFRANGE
member.summary: Out of range is when a user is trying to set a setting with a value that is not supported.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_QUERYINPROGRESS
member.summary: Query is in progress

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_NOTAUTHORIZED
member.summary: Bad authentication.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_UNKNOWNAUTH
member.summary: Unknown authentication. This indicates that an error was received that might be related to authentication, but there is no way to find out.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeStatus.ONVIF_NOTIMPLEMENTED
member.summary: Not Implemented. This indicates that the function call was not implemented in the device.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeApi.ONVIF_MAXURLSIZE
member.summary: Maximum size of a URL. This is mainly used to set buffer sizes.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeApi.FreeNativeMemory(System.Byte*)
member.summary: Frees the memory allocated in native code.
member.param: Memory pointer that was passed up to us from native code.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeApi.GrabDiscoveryMutex
member.summary: Grabs the discovery mutex.
member.returns: True if successfully grabbed the mutex otherwise False.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeApi.ReleaseDiscoveryMutex
member.summary: Releases the discovery mutex.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeApi.DiscoveryQuery(System.UInt32,System.Byte**,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: Discover ONVIF devices
member.param: Buffer pointer that points to a buffer that will be allocated in native code.
This is so native code can pass back up the size of the buffer.
Length of time in seconds to do the discovery query.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeApi.StartDeviceListener(Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscoveryReceiveMessageCallBack)
member.summary: Starts the listenening for Probe messages from Service Discovery Clients and also listens to Onvif Hello messages from Onvif Clients.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifNativeApi.StopDeviceListener
member.summary: Stops the listenening of Probe messages from Service Discovery Clients and Onvif Hello messages from Onvif Clients.

member.summary: Query is in progress. This means that another query will not be started.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifProfile

summary.para: Each OnvifDevice has a list of Profile(s) of which each Profile encapsulates a majority of what we want to do: Setting/Getting attributes and getting the streaming Uri.
Each OnvifDevice can have more than one Profile.

member.remarks:
Note:
The Profile class keeps a local copy of the Video Options and Streaming URL which can be modified by other means (such as when the user changes camera settings via their web browser). To get the latest Video Options and Streaming URL call GetStreamUri and GetVideoOptions methods.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifProfile.ToString
member.summary: Returns a System.String that represents the current Profile class.
member.returns: Profile Name

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifProfile.VideoOptions
member.summary: List of video options.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifProfile.#ctor
member.summary: Private constructor - no one should call this.

member.summary: OnvifDevice will call this constructor when getting profiles from the device.

member.summary: Provides the streaming Uri used to view the video stream.
member.returns: The stream Uri of the ONVIF device

member.summary: Check if a uri requires authentication by making a request to the server with no credentials.

member.summary: Retrieves streaming URI list from the profile and updates it to the Profile class's _StreamUriList property.

member.summary: Retrieves the snapshot URI of the profile and updates it to the Profile class's SnapshotURI property.
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifProfile.GetVideoOptions
member.summary: Retrieves the video options provided by the profile on the device.

remarks.para: The Profile class keeps a local copy of the video options which can be modified on the device by other means (such as when a user modifies settings through the device's web interface, etc). Call GetVideoOptions to get the latest video options.

member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory

member.summary: Updates the username and passwords in the streaming uri list.

member.summary: Exception with the message populated with the Exception information and the innerException is null.

member.summary: Exception with the message and innerException populated.
member.param: Information on what caused the exception.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDevice
member.summary:
ONVIF Device
You can get a list of ONVIF devices from the Discovery class's Query method.
Example use of an OnvifDevice:
OnvifDevice provides a list of profiles that the device has to offer
Check each profile which has the resolution, bitrate, and framerate
Select a profile you want to work with
If needed you can set the resolution, bitrate, or framerate of the profile you select
Call the GetStreamUri method on the profile you selected to get the streaming URI
member.remarks:
Note:
The OnvifDevice class keeps a local copy of the Profile and Capabilities which can be modified by other means (such as when the user changes camera settings via their web browser). To get the latest profiles and capabilities call GetCapabilities and GetProfiles methods.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDevice.ToString
member.summary: Returns a System.String that represents the current OnvifDevice class.
member.returns: OnvifDevice with URI

member.summary: List of Network Interfaces

member.summary: Update the credentials in the profiles so that all the stream uri's have the new credentials.

Password to be used for authentication.

member.summary: Queries the device for its capabilities. Currently we only support PTZ and Media
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory

member.summary: Queries the device for PTZ Service. SupportsPTZ will be set to true if the device has PTZ Service.
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory

OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory

eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDevice.GetProfiles
member.summary: Queries the device for its profiles and stores the profiles in the Profile property.

remarks.para: GetProfiles will be called when instantiating OnvifDevice. Call GetProfiles() again to refresh the list of profiles.

member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDevice.GetNetworkInterfaces
member.summary: Queries the device for its network interfaces. Results will be updated in OnvifDevice class properties.
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.PTZControl.AbsoluteMove(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: AbsoluteMove moves the device to the PTZ position with corresponding speed.
member.param: paramPanPosition is the absolute pan position to move to.
paramTiltPosition is the absolute tilt position to move to.
paramZoomPosition is the absolute zoom position to move to.
paramPanSpeed is the speed at which to pan for this absolute move operation.
paramTiltSpeed is the speed at which to tilt for this absolute move operation.
paramZoomSpeed is the speed at which to zoom for this absolute move operation.
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory
OUTOFRANGE - Parameter out of range.

remarks.para: For all parameters the numerical range is -1.0 to 1.0. If the speed is set to zero the default speed of the device will be used.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.PTZControl.RelativeMove(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: RelativeMove moves the device from the current position over by the PTZ translation with corresponding speed.
member.param: paramPanTranslation is the translation pan position to move to relative to the current position.
paramTiltTranslation is the translation tilt position to move to relative to the current position.
paramZoomTranslation is the translation zoom position to move to. relative to the current position.
paramPanSpeed is the speed at which to pan for this relative move operation.
paramTiltSpeed is the speed at which to tilt for this relative move operation.
paramZoomSpeed is the speed at which to zoom for this relative move operation.
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory
OUTOFRANGE - Parameter out of range.

remarks.para: For all parameters the numerical range is -1.0 to 1.0. If the speed is set to zero the default speed of the device will be used.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.PTZControl.ContinuousMove(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Puts the ONVIF device into a continuous move.
member.param: paramPanSpeed is the speed at which to pan for this continuous move operation.
paramTiltSpeed is the speed at which to tilt for this continuous move operation.
paramZoomSpeed is the speed at which to zoom for this continuous move operation.
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory
OUTOFRANGE - Parameter out of range.

remarks.para: For all parameters the numerical range is -1.0 to 1.0. If the speed is set to zero the default speed of the device will be used.

member.summary: Stops all continuous move.

eOnvifStatus:

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery
member.summary:
How to use Crestron ONVIF
The Discovery class has a Query method that returns a list of devices. You can then use the devices in the list to look at a device's profile.
Each device can have one or more profiles, for example a camera can have one profile for low resolution and another profile for high resolution. Most of the key settings such are resolution and bitrate are done in the profile class.
example usage:
Do a Discover to get the list of available devices
Pick a device to work with
Get the resolution and bitrate of each profile in the device
Choose which profile you would like to use
Get the streaming Uri of that profile

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.DeviceList
member.summary: List of Device options.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.#cctor
member.summary: Constructor for OnvifDiscovery class

member.summary: Callback function to be called by native to managed code to send the Onvif device information. Error will be logged if any exception is thrown within this function.
member.param: Buffer pointer where the CrestronOnvif.dll copied the device information.
Length of the device information copied.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.CrestronEnvironment_ProgramStatusEventHandler(Crestron.SimplSharp.eProgramStatusEventType)
member.summary: Stop the discovery thread when the program stops.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.Query(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Discovers ONVIF devices. The devices will also be queried for it's information such as capabilities, profiles, and other information.
member.param: Duration of the discovery process in seconds.
member.remarks: This method will block for timeoutInSeconds while discovering. Also note that some ONVIF devices require authentication to query various information and therefore this method may not completely gather all information. After the query is complete you may then update each device's UserName and Password to setup authentication.
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory
MUTEXERROR - Internal mutex error.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.Query(System.UInt32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Discovers ONVIF devices. The devices will also be queried for it's information such as capabilities, profiles, and other information. This method will use the username and password provided in the process of gathering information from the ONVIF device(s). If the device(s) are set with different authentication credentials then you can manually set them in the OnvifDevice's properties for UserName and Password.
member.remarks: This method will block for timeoutInSeconds while discovering. Also note that you may have devices that are set with different UserName and Passwords thus this method may not completely gather all information. After the query is complete you may then update each device's UserName and Password to setup authentication.
member.param: Duration to wait for devices to respond.
User name that is used to authenticate with the OnvifDevice.
Password that is used in conjunction with the UserName to authenticate with the OnvifDevice.
member.returns:
eOnvifStatus:
OK - Successful
FAIL - Unsuccessful
OUTOFMEMORY - Ran out of memory
ONVIF_QUERYINPROGRESS - A query is already in progress.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.StartQuery(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Starts periodic queries to discover devices continuously. Use EndQuery to end.
member.param: Period specifies the wait time between queries in minutes.
Duration specifies the time to wait for devices to respond after a query is sent out.
member.remarks: While the query is in progress calls to the OnvifDiscovery.Query will return eOnvifStatus.QueryInProgress.
member.returns: eOnvifStatus

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.StartQuery(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Starts periodic queries to discover devices. Use to end.
member.param: Period specifies the wait time between queries in minutes. The minimum period is 1 minute and maximum 10,080 minutes (which is one week).
Duration specifies the time to wait for devices to respond after a query is sent out. The minimum duration is 1 minute and maximum duration is 60 minutes.
User name that is used to authenticate with the OnvifDevice.
Password that is used in conjunction with the UserName to authenticate with the OnvifDevice.
member.remarks: While the query is in progress calls to the will return .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.EndQuery
member.summary: Ends the ongoing discovery

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.ProcessDiscoveryData(System.String)
member.summary: Goes through the '\n' delimited list of URI's from the discovery and creates OnvifDevice(s) for ones that are not in the list and adds it to the list. We also notify subscribers to the DeviceFound event with the new device.

member.summary: Start the device listener.
member.exception: Error occurred while trying to start the Device Listener.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.StopDeviceListener
member.summary: Stop the device listener.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Onvif.OnvifDiscovery.ListenForDevices
member.summary: Set to true to listen for devices coming online. Set to false to stop listen...
member.remarks: When a device comes online it will be added to and will trigger . There can only be one device listener on at a time. An exception shall be thrown by native code if one is already running in another program.
member.exception: Error occurred while trying to start/stop the Device Listener.
